content:
Based on the execution logs, here is the updated report:

# EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Production Line at (-15, -50)
- Burner mining drill mining iron ore
- Wooden chest collecting iron ore from mining drill
- Stone furnace smelting iron ore into plates

### Main Production Area (0,0 to 6,4)
- 3 Stone furnaces in a row for iron plate production
- 2 Stone furnaces for copper plate production

### Assembly Line (21-28, 4.5)
- Input wooden chest for iron plates
- Burner inserter feeding from input chest
- Assembling machine producing iron gear wheels
- Burner inserter outputting products
- Output wooden chest storing iron gear wheels (currently 275)
- Small electric poles providing power

### Power Generation System
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5) producing water
- Pipe network connecting pump to boiler
- Boiler at (-2, 23.5) heating water
- Steam engine at (9.5, 19.5) generating power
- Small electric poles distributing power

# ERROR TIPS

### Power Network Issues
- Ensure steam engine is properly connected to the power network
- Check pipe connections between offshore pump, boiler and steam engine
- Monitor boiler fuel levels to maintain consistent power generation

### Resource Management
- Keep mining drills and furnaces fueled to prevent work stoppages
- Ensure consistent ore supply to furnaces to maintain production
- Monitor fuel levels in burner inserters

### Production Line Issues
- Verify assembler has consistent power supply
- Ensure input/output paths are clear and not blocked
- Monitor input chest inventory levels to maintain production flow

### Inventory Management
- Check inventory before attempting to insert items into machines
- Maintain adequate coal supply for all burner-type entities
- Monitor output chest capacity to prevent production blockages
